text: Teerawat Kangtong (born 10 May 1994) is a Thai karateka. In 2019, he won the gold medal in the men's kumite +75 kg event at the 2019 Southeast Asian Games held in Manila, Philippines. In 2015, he won one of the bronze medals in the men's kumite +84 kg event at the 2015 Asian Karate Championships held in Yokohama, Japan. At the 2018 Asian Karate Championships held in Amman, Jordan he won one of the bronze medals in the men's kumite +84 kg event. The following year at the 2019 Asian Karate Championships held in Tashkent, Uzbekistan he also won one of the bronze medals in this event. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable sortable" width=45% style="font-size:90%; text- align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Rank !!Event |- |2015 |Asian Championships |Yokohama, Japan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Kumite +84 kg |- |2018 |Asian Championships |Amman, Jordan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Kumite +84 kg |- |rowspan=2 | 2019 |Asian Championships |Tashkent, Uzbekistan |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Kumite +84 kg |- |Southeast Asian Games |Manila, Philippines |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Kumite +75 kg |} == References == Category:Living people Category:1994 births Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Thai male karateka Category:Karateka at the 2014 Asian Games Category:Karateka at the 2018 Asian Games Category:Southeast Asian Games gold medalists for Thailand Category:Southeast Asian Games medalists in karate Category:Competitors at the 2019 Southeast Asian Games Category:Asian Games competitors for Thailand
title: Teerawat Kangtong
